snippet: As an owner of the Nets when they were in New Jersey, Lewis Katz, who died Saturday in a plane crash, had a plan to help Newark, the state’s largest city.
abstract: Lewis Katz, financier and philanthropist who died along with six others in Boston plane crash, attempted to leverage his part ownership of the New Jersey Nets in late 1990s and early 2000s to revitalize the city of Newark, NJ; while plan detoured and eventually dissolved, team enjoyed its greatest success in the NBA during Katz's ownership.
lead_paragraph: As an owner of the Nets when they were in New Jersey, Lewis Katz, who died Saturday in a plane crash, had a plan to help Newark, the state’s largest city.

headline.main: Lewis Katz’s Vision for the New Jersey Nets Went Unrealized
headline.print_headline: Vision for Nets and Newark Went Unrealized
